title: so many bots now?!
body: How long have all these scripters been ruining league for? i have had a legnthy break and thought it would be a great idea to return. I thought the saltiness would've ceased a little (boy was i wrong) and now Bots ruin your games? .. it almost seems like OCE LoL is dead or dying..

replies.body:
Yea bots are still a thing unfortunately. It's not something we can prevent right now as by the time we've identified that an account is a bot it has usually played a lot of games and gained quite a high level due to the experience to reach 30 being cut in half.

However, we still ban bot accounts when we find them, and player reports are as useful as always in tipping us off. So be sure to keep reporting them and include at least the word "bot" in your report.

In the medium to long term, we are developing better methods for catching them faster and as soon as we can bring that to OCE we will!

>It's not something we can prevent right now as by the time we've identified that an account is a bot it has usually played a lot of games and gained quite a high level due to the experience to reach 30 being cut in half.

And yet you ban people for scripting, and botting is a script.

Hmmm i wonder what the inconsistency is here.

>
> And yet you ban people for scripting, and botting is a script.
> 
> Hmmm i wonder what the inconsistency is here.

I think what they were referring to is that it's often challenging to differentiate between a newly started newbie account and newly started bot account, as they both play awkwardly with bad performance and don't usually interact with/respond to pings and chats. Hence by the time they could narrow down and ban a bot acc with certainty, they've already gained quite a high level and ruined their handful of games.
But you still have to explain how they can ban for third party programs when they can't detect the most simple of bots.

I'm no expert on this matter, but I would assume that bots aren't programmed to perform extraordinary movements and reactions to other player movements, nor do they have any reliance on utilities that help them make those decisions - instead being programmed with simple commands that cannot be 100% reliably distinguished from actual players.

Additionally, bot creators have become more careful and reserved - running less bots from the same location, slowing down their rate of play, making bots that do more than just feed - so new tech that looks beyond just play patterns and big groups of accounts all from the same location is required to drive them down even further.

I'd agree with you if it wasn't for a few facts.

1. 
Normal scripting would be harder to detect in reality, because going off a player's say so is bad, as they can easily be wrong if they don't know what they are talking about, so i have to ask at this point, where do third party program bans actually come from?
2. 
>bot creators have become more careful and reserved
Is that why they still use the same naming convention they have used for years?
Like i wish i was kidding, but the naming convention is a dead giveaway, even if they aren't "playing as often"
3.
>making bots that do more than just feed
Except they don't, there are 3 kinds of bots;
ARAM bot's which just spam abilities and run it down mid with the minions.
SR bot's which run it down mid and feed deliberately (which still don't always get detected.)
and SR bot's which pick a lane to run it down and attempt to trade even if it's wrong, and end up feeding because of it.

And it comes down to this.

**Riot games doesn't actually attempt to stop these bots**

These are the same fucking bots from Season 4, and saying anything other than that in this argument is a null factor.

EDIT: Also again i run into the shitty bb code of boards, and again while replying to a Riot comment.
They don't just run down a lane and try to trade, they attach to a player and attack whatever that player attacks.

Some do, however most bots I've seen in my time playing will simply "auto-chase" enemies and end up feeding because of it, or attach to minion waves and end up feeding because of it (I've only seen the latter in ARAM). Bots that attach to an ally just don't seem to be very common at all.
Champ attach bots are the only ones i have seen in sr
